abstract: Former NFL tight end Ben Utecht, whose book Counting the Days While My Mind Slips Away details how repeated hits to head debilitated his life and career, has spent years since his 2010 retirement spreading awareness about dangers of concussions; critics suggest Utecht, journeyman player whose stint in league was just six seasons, is exploiting current controversy over concussions.

headline.print_headline: Average Player Tells His Concussion Story
headline.main: In a Book, an Ex-N.F.L. Player Details Consequences of Concussions

keywords.value: Counting the Days While My Mind Slips Away (Book)
keywords.name: creative_works

snippet: Ben Utecht, who retired in 2010 after too many hits to the head, has made it his mission to speak out about the dangers of head trauma and how it affected him....
